Our Purpose

Climate Change and Bio-diversity

- Promoting Eco-Friendly Practices
- Impacting Climate Change Through Reforestation

Flora and Fauna Sustainability

- Establishment Nurseries of Indigenous Trees
- Creation of Green Cover and Forests
- Development of Wildlife Habitats

Water Sustainability

- Creation and Restoration of Rainwater Harvesters
- Conservation of Water
- Construction of Ponds, Tanks, and Pipelines

Dignity and Health

- Addressing Health and Medical Needs
- Ensuring Access to Clean Drinking Water

Environmental Research

- Studies on Environmental Issues
- Soil and Water Preservation Research

Livelihood Support

- Empowering Tribals and Below Poverty Line (BPL) Communities
- Promoting Sustainable Agriculture Practices

Waste Management and Renewable Energy

- Advocacy for Waste Management
- Promotion of Renewable Energy Sources

Humanitarian Assistance and Disaster Relief (HADR)

- Participation in Government Schemes
- Community Welfare in Rural Areas

What We Do

We at HarNeer are engaged in the environment, empowerment, and social welfare at the grassroots level. We work for water, Flora and Fauna Sustainability, Climate change and Eco biodiversity; we create/restore overground and underground rainwater harvesters. Promote & execute conservation of water usage by creation of ponds, tanks, pipelines, and other rainwater harvesting structures and by use of modern practices. Establish nurseries to create green cover and forests of indigenous trees to impact climate change and create wildlife habitats. In Community Empowerment and Equality: we address dignity, health/medical, drinking water and livelihood of tribals and BPL. We promote and advocate sustainable agriculture practices, waste management and renewable energy. HADR and Govt Schemes participation in general public utility and community welfare especially in rural areas. We also carry out research work on environmental issues, and soil and water preservation. 

Target UN SDGs

Our Strengths and Best Practices

A grassroot non-profit with core values of “Selfless service and Country First”, our best practices include:- 

  • Clear aim: we seek only work and not credit. 
  • Well-organized, functional, transparent and robust organizational structures. SOPs and well-defined & clear-cut charters. 
  • Dedicated and experienced project leaders. 
  • Well-established base for grassroots operations. 
  • Passion, Integrity and excellence.
  • Coordination with Local administration and state/central departments. 

Why Us

 Credibility, transparency and accountability are stated benchmarks of the HarNeer Foundation and are achieved through good governance in the processes and practices. We have a multi-tier audit and evaluation mechanism to ensure the impact of investment and complete transparency and accountability in the utilisation of funds.

Our Team

Patron & Mentor

Major Jameet Singh (Retd)

Founder Director

Ms Shagun Singh

Co-Founder

Mrs Ritu Singh
